TopicTitle: PartModule - How do you run code when the part is unloaded / destroyed in flight mode

Articles.Content:
I'm trying to run code when my part is unloaded / destroyed, but nothing seems to work. I've tried a few different things includeing overriding OnInactive but it doesn't seem to fire.

I can't find anything on the forums either, can anyone help me out?
Look at GameEvents, I'm pretty sure there is something like onVesselUnloaded, and there is an onPartDestroyed
OnDestroy() runs when the instance is destroyed, it's the Unity equivalent of a destructor.

OnDestroy() runs when the instance is destroyed, it's the Unity equivalent of a destructor.

Was not sure if it actually ran when the part is destroyed in flight, the more you know I guess.
Certainly it does for most monobehaviours that are destroyed; can't hurt to test for parts (i.e. PartModules) though.

On 26-12-2014 at 1:11 AM, NathanKell said:

OnDestroy() runs when the instance is destroyed, it's the Unity equivalent of a destructor.

In KSP 1.2.1, I cannot find OnDestroy in PartModule, where did it go?
It is a MonoBehaviour message. You won't see it in the code. Just declare it and Unity will call it.
